quotes: It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one.
author: George Washington

quotes: It is better to be alone than in bad company.
author: George Washington

quotes: If freedom of speech is taken away, then dumb and silent we may be led, like sheep to the slaughter.
author: George Washington

quotes: Human happiness and moral duty are inseparably connected.
author: George Washington

quotes: 99% of failures come from people who make excuses.
author: George Washington

quotes: Guard against the impostures of pretended patriotism.
author: George Washington

quotes: Perseverance and spirit have done wonders in all ages
author: George Washington

quotes: Few men have virtue to withstand the highest bidder.
author: George Washington

quotes: A sensible woman can never be happy with a fool.
author: George Washington

quotes: Happiness depends more upon the internal frame of a personâ€™s own mind, than on the externals in the world.
author: George Washington

quotes: The harder the conflict, the greater the triumph.
author: George Washington

quotes: Worry is the interest paid by those who borrow trouble.
author: George Washington

quotes: I conceive a knowledge of books is the basis upon which other knowledge is to be built.
author: George Washington

quotes: o encourage literature and the arts is a duty which every good citizen owes to his country.
author: George Washington

quotes: We must consult our means rather than our wishes.
author: George Washington

quotes: Real men despise battle, but will never run from it.
author: George Washington

quotes: Discipline is the soul of an army. It makes small numbers formidable; procures success to the weak, and esteem to all.
author: George Washington

quotes: We should not look back unless it is to derive useful lessons from past errors, and for the purpose of profiting by dearly bought experience.
author: George Washington

quotes: I hold the maxim no less applicable to public than to private affairs, that honesty is always the best policy.
author: George Washington

quotes: No punishment, in my opinion, is to great, for the man who can build his greatness upon his country's ruin.
author: George Washington

quotes: Gentlemen, you will permit me to put on my spectacles, for, I have grown not only gray, but almost blind in the service of my country.
author: George Washington

quotes: Be not glad at the misfortune of another, though he may be your enemy.
author: George Washington

quotes: Individuals entering into society, must give up a share of liberty to preserve the rest.
author: George Washington

quotes: Let us raise a standard to which the wise and honest can repair; the rest is in the hands of God.
author: George Washington

quotes: Mankind, when left to themselves, are unfit for their own government.
author: George Washington

quotes: Knowledge is in every country the surest basis of public happiness.
author: George Washington
